snippet: After weeks of talks that often pitted Western governments against Russia, China and developing countries, the United States announced it would not sign the agreement.
abstract: Talks on proposed treaty governing international telecommunications collapse in acrimony as United States rejects agreement on eve of its scheduled signing, citing inability to resolve impasse over the Internet; announcement is seconded by Canada and several European countries after weeks of talks that often pitted Western countries against Russia, China and developing countries.
lead_paragraph: After weeks of talks that often pitted Western governments against Russia, China and developing countries, the United States announced it would not sign the agreement.

headline.seo: Citing Internet Standoff, U.S. Rejects International Telecommunications Treaty
headline.print_headline: Citing Internet Impasse, The U.S. Rejects a Treaty
